posts.author: HipRedux
posts.content:
It's not clear exactly what you are looking to do.  For the OC, you will need a level 18 build.  For SoU/HotU, one capped at 28.  Neither of those are suitable for a dragon shape focus even with bridge modules stuck in.
OmegaSage wrote:
So how would (pre-20) 5M/11SH/4D then building to somehting like 18D/5M/11SH????



 
You need at least Dru 5 to qualify for shifter.  Also, only 10 levels of shifter is available during pre-epic.  If you go shifter, you don't need Dru 18 unless you want that many levels.  That's for a druid dragon shape.  Ummm... let's see if I can capsulize...

For Dragon Shape only druid 18 (WildShp x6)  or shifter 10 is required.  Your main problem will be reaching WIS 30 and for the earliest DS possible, CoT must be used. Either dru/mnk/CoT or dru/shf/CoT requires Level 30 to qualify for DS, the earliest unless custom content changes those requirements.

Monk AC, WIS AC, monk speed and feats merge with all forms.  Monk attack progression (-3 BAB) only merges with shapes that use creature weapons.

edit:  Just to give you a taste of playing shifter in a limited campaign, here is a sample build to try out.  After becoming more familiar with how shifting works, leave your impressions in this thread.  I've played a Risen Lord before in the SoU/HotU combo with success so once you have established your own style, I could dig that one up for a 28-level cap build.

This one, however, focuses on (but not limited to) 3 shapes: Wyrmling, Minotaur, Drider... in that order.  For stronger minotaur (in case Level 18/shf 5 seems unreachable), use alternate feat sequence.  Only wyrmling (and other unarmed shapes) will benefit from the monk attack progression.  The merge is always better for armed shapes. 93 skill points are left open for allocation of your personal preference (eg. high stealth, heal or xclass skills).  Attack: 3 APR w/weapons, 4 APR unarmed. Dru 7 @ Lvl 11 assures full druid circle quest is available.  Ignore the native combat stats because they will be adjusted by the current shape.
